data.description: Leidos is seeking a Data Pipeline / Splunk Engineering Intern with a Computer Science, Data Science, or similar technical background to join our team in support of the SMIT contract, the largest IT services program for the U.S. Navy.Under the Service Management, Integration, and Transport (SMIT) program, the Leidos team delivers the core backbone of the Navy–Marine Corps Intranet (NMCI), including cybersecurity services, network operations, service desk, and data transport. The team supports the Navy in unifying enterprise data to improve operational visibility, reliability, and decision-making.The successful candidate will support data ingestion, transformation, and analytics pipelines that feed Splunk dashboards and monitoring solutions used by network operations teams, site reliability engineers (SREs), and executive leadership. This internship provides hands-on experience in data engineering, Python development, enterprise observability, and Agile delivery within a mission-critical environment.Primary ResponsibilitiesSupport development and maintenance of data pipelines that ingest, transform, and deliver data to Splunk and analytics platformsWrite and maintain Python scripts to process log, metric, and event dataAssist with data validation, normalization, and enrichment to improve data quality and usabilitySupport onboarding of new data sources from infrastructure, applications, and network systemsAssist with building dashboards and visualizations that consume pipeline-produced dataPerform analysis, trending, and exploratory data analysis to identify insights and anomaliesCollaborate with Splunk developers, SREs, and operations teams to understand data requirementsParticipate in Agile ceremonies including daily scrums, sprint planning, and retrospectivesContribute to backlog items, technical documentation, and process improvementsWork with a geographically distributed (remote) teamBasic QualificationsEnrolled in a Bachelor’s degree program in Computer Science, Data Science, Software Engineering, Information Systems, or related field Experience with Python programmingCoursework or hands-on experience with data processing or data pipelinesFamiliarity with structured or semi-structured data (e.g., JSON, CSV, log files)Strong analytical and problem-solving skillsAbility to work collaboratively and learn in a fast-paced technical environmentHolds or has ability to obtain a secret Level security clearanceUS citizenship requiredGPA of 3.0 or higherPreferred QualificationsExposure to Splunk or other log analytics / observability platformsExperience with data visualization tools or libraries (e.g., Splunk dashboards, matplotlib, Plotly, Power BI, Tableau)Familiarity with REST APIs and data ingestion patternsExposure to Linux environments or command-line toolingExperience with version control systems such as GitFamiliarity with Agile development and tools such as Jira or Azure DevOpsInterest in data engineering, site reliability engineering (SRE), or observability platformsSecurity+ certification or interest in pursuing DoD-aligned certificationsAt Leidos, we don’t want someone who "fits the mold"—we want someone who melts it down and builds something better. This is a role for the restless, the over-caffeinated, the ones who ask, “what’s next?” before the dust settles on “what’s now.”If you’re already scheming step 20 while everyone else is still debating step 2… good. You’ll fit right in.Original Posting:January 9, 2026For U.S. Positions: While subject to change based on business needs, Leidos reasonably anticipates that this job requisition will remain open for at least 3 days with an anticipated close date of no earlier than 3 days after the original posting date as listed above.Pay Range:Pay Range $48,100.00 - $86,950.00The Leidos pay range for this job level is a general guideline only and not a guarantee of compensation or salary. Additional factors considered in extending an offer include (but are not limited to) responsibilities of the job, education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities, as well as internal equity, alignment with market data, applicable bargaining agreement (if any), or other law.
requirements: Collaborate with Splunk developers, SREs, and operations teams to understand data requirements
Enrolled in a Bachelor’s degree program in Computer Science, Data Science, Software Engineering, Information Systems, or related field
responsibilities: Support development and maintenance of data pipelines that ingest, transform, and deliver data to Splunk and analytics platforms
Familiarity with Agile development and tools such as Jira or Azure DevOps
